title: ICE: When using an associated type as the type parameter of a bound

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: E-needs-test
labels.description: Call for participation: writing correctness tests

labels.name: A-associated-items
labels.description: Area: Associated items such as associated types and consts.

body:
Found this ICE while trying to convert the `S` in `Hasher<S>` into an associated type. (FWIW, I also hit #18611 in the process)
### STR

``` rust
#![feature(associated_types)]

pub trait Hasher{
    type State;

    fn hash<T: Hash< <Self as Hasher>::State>>(&self, value: &T) -> u64;
}

trait Hash<S> {
    fn hash(&self, state: &mut S);
}
```
### Output

``` rust
task 'rustc' panicked at 'index out of bounds: the len is 0 but the index is 0', /var/tmp/paludis/build/dev-lang-rust-scm/work/rust-scm/src/librustc/middle/subst.rs:388
```
